intro: Pimelea cryptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf wallaby bush, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically appearing in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pimelea cryptica is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, making it a resilient species in arid and semi-arid environments.
